MS MCQs

    Dynamics 365 Business Central

    »

    1. Who is Dynamics 365 Business Central designed to help?

      Dynamics 365 Business Central is designed for small and midsize businesses that have outgrown their siloed management tools and want to streamline their processes.

      Dynamic 365 Business Central is designed exclusively for operations managers to use sales forecasts and expected stock-outs to automatically generate production plans and purchase orders.

      Dynamics 365 Business Central is designed exclusively for project managers who need to make effective decisions with real-time insights.


    2. A hair salon is considering upgrading its business software. The current software systems aren’t connected and don’t meet the needs of the growing business. Which of the following describes a benefit of moving to Dynamics 365 Business Central?

      Dynamics 365 Business Central offers a booking platform that features remote and onsite management for customers.

      Dynamics 365 Business Central allows a business to set up customized Role Centers within a single tool, creating personalized entry points for each employee type.

      Dynamics 365 Business Central offers streamlined employee onboarding processes, including personalized training plans for each new stylist.


    3. What is the user’s entry point for Dynamics 365 Business Central?

      The Dynamics 365 Consolidated Dashboard

      A user-centric home page or Role Center

      The Dynamics 365 Business Center Hub
